block.p: GOLF Bryant Holds On to Win Disney Classic

After 18 seasons and 460 PGA Tour events, persistence paid off for Brad Bryant yesterday. Bryant, who shared the lead entering the final round of the rain-shortened Walt Disney Classic, held off the charges of his main challengers to survive and win his first Tour victory and the $216,000 first prize in the tournament at Lake Buena Vista, Fla., by one stroke. Bryant shot a 68 yesterday to finish with an 18-under-par, 54-hole total of 198. Hal Sutton (66) and Ted Tryba (65) tied for second. (AP)
GOLF Bryant Holds On to Win Disney Classic

After 18 seasons and 460 PGA Tour events, persistence paid off for Brad Bryant yesterday. Bryant, who shared the lead entering the final round of the rain-shortened Walt Disney Classic, held off the charges of his main challengers to survive and win his first Tour victory and the $216,000 first prize in the tournament at Lake Buena Vista, Fla., by one stroke. Bryant shot a 68 yesterday to finish with an 18-under-par, 54-hole total of 198. Hal Sutton (66) and Ted Tryba (65) tied for second. (AP)

TREVINO TRIUMPHS: Lee Trevino shot a six-under 66 for a three-stroke victory in The Transamerica in Napa, Calif. Trevino, 55, finished with a 15-under 201 total on Silverado's South Course for his 26th victory over all on the Senior PGA Tour. (AP) HOCKEY First Victory for Panthers' New Coach
Scott Mellanby scored twice as the Florida Panthers edged the Calgary Flames, 4-3, last night in Miami to give their new coach, Doug MacLean, his first National Hockey League victory. (AP)

RED WINGS 3, OILERS 1: The Detroit captain Steve Yzerman scored once and assisted on the game-winning goal as the Red Wings spoiled Edmonton's home opener. (AP) CYCLING Winner From Spain Finishes on a Flat Tire

Abraham Olano beat his Spanish compatriot Miguel Indurain in the professional road race at the world championships in Duitama, Colombia, yesterday, finishing the 165-mile course on a flat tire. Olano won in 7 hours 9 minutes 55 seconds. Indurain, the five-time Tour de France champion, was 35 seconds behind. (AP) TENNIS Majoli Claims Her First Professional Title
Seventh-seeded Iva Majoli of Croatia upset No. 2 Mary Pierce, 6-4, 6-4, yesterday to win the European Indoors in Zurich for her first professional title. (AP)
